root.title: JSON schema for SchemaStore.org catalog files

schemas.description: A list of JSON schema references.

fileMatch.description: A Mimimatch expression for matching up file names with a schema.

url.description: An absolute URL to the schema location

version.description: The schema version of the catalog

root.description: Modified JSON Schema draft v4 that includes the optional '$ref' and 'format'

root.title: JSON schema for Bower configuration files

^_.description: Any property starting with _ is valid.

description.description: Help users identify and search for your package with a brief description.

main.description: The primary acting files necessary to use your package.

license.description: SPDX license identifier or path/url to a license.

ignore.description: A list of files for Bower to ignore when installing your package.

keywords.description: Used for search by keyword. Helps make your package easier to discover without people needing to know its name.

authors.description: A list of people that authored the contents of the package.

homepage.description: URL to learn more about the package. Falls back to GitHub project if not specified and it's a GitHub endpoint.

repository.description: The repository in which the source code can be found.

dependencies.description: Dependencies are specified with a simple hash of package name to a semver compatible identifier or URL.

devDependencies.description: Dependencies that are only needed for development of the package, e.g., test framework or building documentation.

resolutions.description: Dependency versions to automatically resolve with if conflicts occur between packages.

private.description: If you set it to  true  it will refuse to publish it. This is a way to prevent accidental publication of private repositories.

http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#.description: Modified JSON Schema draft v4 that includes the optional '$ref' and 'format'

http://schemastore.org/schemas/json/jshi.title: JSON schema for JSHint configuration files

curly.description: Require {} for every new block or scope

forin.description: Require filtering for..in loops with obj.hasOwnProperty()

immed.description: Require immediate invocations to be wrapped in parens e.g. `(function () { } ());`

indent.description: Number of spaces to use for indentation

latedef.description: Require variables/functions to be defined before being used

newcap.description: Require capitalization of all constructor functions e.g. `new F()`

nonew.description: Prohibit use of constructors for side-effects (without assignment)

undef.description: Require all non-global variables to be declared (prevents global leaks)

unused.description: Require all defined variables be used

strict.description: Requires all functions run in ES5 Strict Mode

maxparams.description: Max number of formal params allowed per function

maxdepth.description: Max depth of nested blocks (within functions)

maxlen.description: Max number of characters per line

boss.description: Tolerate assignments where comparisons would be expected

debug.description: Allow debugger statements e.g. browser breakpoints

es5.description: Allow ES5 syntax (ex: getters and setters)

moz.description: Allow Mozilla specific syntax (extends and overrides esnext features)

funcscope.description: Tolerate defining variables inside control statements

lastsemic.description: Tolerate omitting a semicolon for the last statement of a 1-line block

loopfunc.description: Tolerate functions being defined in loops

smarttabs.description: Tolerate mixed tabs/spaces when used for alignment

shadow.description: Allows re-define variables later in code e.g. `var x=1; x=2;`

sub.description: Tolerate using `[]` notation when it can still be expressed in dot notation

validthis.description: Tolerate using this in a non-constructor function

expand.description: Must be set to true to use properties other than 'src' and 'dest'

cwd.description: All 'src' matches are relative to (but don't include) this path

ext.description: Replace any existing extension with this value in generated 'dest' paths.

extDot.description: Used to indicate where the period indicating the extension is located.

filter.description: The 'filter' property can help you target files with a greater level of detail

flatten.description: Remove all path parts from generated 'dest' paths

matchBase.description: If set, patterns without slashes will be matched against the basename of the path if it contains slashes. For example, 'a?b' would match the path '/xyz/123/acb', but not '/xyz/acb/123'.

nonull.description: If set to 'true' then the operation will include non-matching patterns. Combined with grunt's '--verbose' flag, this option can help debug file path issues.

rename.description: This function is called for each matched 'src' file, (after extension renaming and flattening).

src.description: Pattern(s) to match, relative to the 'cwd'.

root.title: JSON schema for .bowerrc files

cwd.description: The directory from which bower should run. All relative paths will be calculated according to this setting.

directory.description: The directory from which bower should run. All relative paths will be calculated according to this setting.

json.description: A file path to the Bower configuration file

search.description: An array of URLs pointing to read-only Bower registries. A string means only one. When looking into the registry for an endpoint, Bower will query these registries by the specified order.

register.description: The URL to use when registering packages.

publish.description: The URL to use when publishing packages.

proxy.description: The proxy to use for http requests.

https-proxy.description: The proxy to use for https requests.

user-agent.description: Sets the User-Agent for each request made.

timeout.description: he timeout to be used when making requests in milliseconds.

strict-ssl.description: Whether or not to do SSL key validation when making requests via https.

ca.description: The CA certificates to be used, defaults to null. This is similar to the registry key, specifying each CA to use for each registry endpoint.

color.description: Enable or disable use of colors in the CLI output.

storage.description: Where to store persistent data, such as cache, needed by bower.

tmp.description: Where to store temporary files and folders

interactive.description: Makes bower interactive, prompting whenever necessary

root.title: JSON schema for coffeelint.json files

arrow_spacing.description: This rule checks to see that there is spacing before and after the arrow operator that declares a function.

camel_case_classes.description: This rule mandates that all class names are CamelCased. Camel casing class names is a generally accepted way of distinguishing constructor functions - which require the 'new' prefix to behave properly - from plain old functions.

colon_assignment_spacing.description: This rule checks to see that there is spacing before and after the colon in a colon assignment (i.e., classes, objects).

cyclomatic_complexity.description: Examine the complexity of your application.

duplicate_key.description: Prevents defining duplicate keys in object literals and classes.

empty_constructor_needs_parens.description: Requires constructors with no parameters to include the parens.

indentation.description: This rule imposes a standard number of spaces to be used for indentation. Since whitespace is significant in CoffeeScript, it's critical that a project chooses a standard indentation format and stays consistent. Other roads lead to darkness.

line_endings.description: This rule ensures your project uses only windows or unix line endings.

max_line_length.description: This rule imposes a maximum line length on your code.

missing_fat_arrows.description: Warns when you use `this` inside a function that wasn't defined with a fat arrow. This rule does not apply to methods defined in a class, since they have `this` bound to the class instance (or the class itself, for class methods).

newlines_after_classes.description: Checks the number of newlines between classes and other code.

no_backticks.description: Backticks allow snippets of JavaScript to be embedded in CoffeeScript. While some folks consider backticks useful in a few niche circumstances, they should be avoided because so none of JavaScript's "bad parts", like with and eval, sneak into CoffeeScript.

no_empty_param_list.description: This rule prohibits empty parameter lists in function definitions.

no_implicit_braces.description: This rule prohibits implicit braces when declaring object literals. Implicit braces can make code more difficult to understand, especially when used in combination with optional parenthesis.

no_implicit_parens.description: This rule prohibits implicit parens on function calls.

no_interpolation_in_single_quotes.description: This rule prohibits string interpolation in a single quoted string.

no_plusplus.description: This rule forbids the increment and decrement arithmetic operators. Some people believe the ++ and -- to be cryptic and the cause of bugs due to misunderstandings of their precedence rules.

no_stand_alone_at.description: This rule checks that no stand alone @ are in use, they are discouraged.

no_tabs.description: This rule forbids tabs in indentation. Enough said.

no_throwing_strings.description: This rule forbids throwing string literals or interpolations. While JavaScript (and CoffeeScript by extension) allow any expression to be thrown, it is best to only throw  Error objects, because they contain valuable debugging information like the stack trace.

no_trailing_semicolons.description: This rule prohibits trailing semicolons, since they are needless cruft in CoffeeScript.

no_trailing_whitespace.description: This rule forbids trailing whitespace in your code, since it is needless cruft.

no_unnecessary_double_quotes.description: This rule prohibits double quotes unless string interpolation is used or the string contains single quotes.

no_unnecessary_fat_arrows.description: Disallows defining functions with fat arrows when `this` is not used within the function.

non_empty_constructor_needs_parens.description: Requires constructors with parameters to include the parens.

space_operators.description: This rule enforces that operators have space around them.

root.title: JSON schema for component.json files

private.description: A boolean specifying whether the component is private, defaulting to  false.

name.description: A public component MUST have a 'name'. This is what will be passed to  require().

repo.description: The public component MUST have a 'repository' property, this is registry end-point consisting of  <username>/<project> , for example 'visionmedia/page.js' or 'component/dialog'.

description.description: The component SHOULD have a 'description' property. This helps people find and understand your component.

version.description: The public component MUST include a version, allowing other scripts to depend on specific releases of the component.

keywords.description: Keywords are used when searching for a component. A public component SHOULD list a few keywords.

main.description: It is recommended that you use 'index.js' for the main component file, however if you use another filename, you MUST define a 'main' field for that.

scripts.description: The  scripts  field explicitly specifies the scripts for this component. For public components, these must be regular JavaScript files. For private components, these should be regular Javascript files.

styles.description: The  styles  field explicitly specifies the stylesheets for this component. For public components, these must be regular CSS files. For private components, these should be regular CSS files.

json.description: The  json  field explicitly specifies the  JSON  files for this component. Each file must be valid  JSON .

images.description: The  images  field MUST be supported and fetched upon installation, this allows component build tools to rewrite stylesheet  url() s in order to accomodate various file serving techniques.

fonts.description: The  fonts  field MUST be supported and fetched upon installation, this allows component build tools to rewrite stylesheet  url() s in order to accomodate various file serving techniques.

files.description: In the future we will classify more file types, however for those which are not treated uniquely such as fonts may be placed in a  files  array to aid build and installation tools.

locals.description: Local dependencies are already located on disk, these are not installed, but are however included in the builds, thus no versions need to be defined. Local components should be located in a directory specified within .paths.

remotes.description: The public component must not contain any remotes.

paths.description: The public component must not contain any paths.

templates.description: The templates array MUST provide the contents of each file as a require-able module. For example the following must provide the HTML string via require('user.html').

license.description: The license string such as 'MIT' may be used for search output and other reporting, developers SHOULD specify this field

root.title: JSON schema for the Grunt Watch task

files.description: One or more files to watch.

tasks.description: One or more tasks to run.

events.description: Specify the type watch event that trigger the specified task.

eventType.description: Specify the type watch event that trigger the specified task.

options.description: One or more files to watch.

spawn.description: Whether to spawn task runs in a child process.

interrupt.description: As files are modified this watch task will spawn tasks in child processes.

debounceDelay.description: How long to wait before emitting events in succession for the same filepath and status. For example if your Gruntfile.js file was changed, a 'changed' event will only fire again after the given milliseconds.

interval.description: The interval is passed to 'fs.watchFile'. Since 'interval' is only used by 'fs.watchFile' and this watcher also uses 'fs.watch'; it is recommended to ignore this option.

reload.description: By default, if Gruntfile.js is being watched, then changes to it will trigger the watch task to restart, and reload the Gruntfile.js changes. When reload is set to true, changes to any of the watched files will trigger the watch task to restart. This is especially useful if your Gruntfile.js is dependent on other files.

forever.description: This is only a task level option and cannot be configured per target. By default the watch task will duck punch grunt.fatal and grunt.warn to try and prevent them from exiting the watch process. If you don't want grunt.fatal and grunt.warn to be overridden set the forever option to false.

atBegin.description: This option will trigger the run of each specified task at startup of the watcher.

livereload.description: If enabled a live reload server will be started with the watch task per target. Then after the indicated tasks have run, the live reload server will be triggered with the modified files.

cwd.description: Ability to set the current working directory.

livereloadOnError.description: Option to prevent the livereload if the executed tasks encountered an error. If set to  false , the livereload will only be triggered if all tasks completed successfully.

http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#.description: Modified JSON Schema draft v4 that includes the optional '$ref' and 'format'

http://schemastore.org/schemas/json/jshi.title: JSON schema for JSHint configuration files

curly.description: Require {} for every new block or scope

forin.description: Require filtering for..in loops with obj.hasOwnProperty()

immed.description: Require immediate invocations to be wrapped in parens e.g. `(function () { } ());`

indent.description: Number of spaces to use for indentation

latedef.description: Require variables/functions to be defined before being used

newcap.description: Require capitalization of all constructor functions e.g. `new F()`

nonew.description: Prohibit use of constructors for side-effects (without assignment)

undef.description: Require all non-global variables to be declared (prevents global leaks)

unused.description: Require all defined variables be used

strict.description: Requires all functions run in ES5 Strict Mode

maxparams.description: Max number of formal params allowed per function

maxdepth.description: Max depth of nested blocks (within functions)

maxlen.description: Max number of characters per line

boss.description: Tolerate assignments where comparisons would be expected

debug.description: Allow debugger statements e.g. browser breakpoints

es5.description: Allow ES5 syntax (ex: getters and setters)

moz.description: Allow Mozilla specific syntax (extends and overrides esnext features)

funcscope.description: Tolerate defining variables inside control statements

lastsemic.description: Tolerate omitting a semicolon for the last statement of a 1-line block

loopfunc.description: Tolerate functions being defined in loops

smarttabs.description: Tolerate mixed tabs/spaces when used for alignment

shadow.description: Allows re-define variables later in code e.g. `var x=1; x=2;`

sub.description: Tolerate using `[]` notation when it can still be expressed in dot notation

validthis.description: Tolerate using this in a non-constructor function

expand.description: Must be set to true to use properties other than 'src' and 'dest'

cwd.description: All 'src' matches are relative to (but don't include) this path

ext.description: Replace any existing extension with this value in generated 'dest' paths.

extDot.description: Used to indicate where the period indicating the extension is located.

filter.description: The 'filter' property can help you target files with a greater level of detail

flatten.description: Remove all path parts from generated 'dest' paths

matchBase.description: If set, patterns without slashes will be matched against the basename of the path if it contains slashes. For example, 'a?b' would match the path '/xyz/123/acb', but not '/xyz/acb/123'.

nonull.description: If set to 'true' then the operation will include non-matching patterns. Combined with grunt's '--verbose' flag, this option can help debug file path issues.

rename.description: This function is called for each matched 'src' file, (after extension renaming and flattening).

src.description: Pattern(s) to match, relative to the 'cwd'.

root.title: JSON schema for JSCS configuration files

checkParamNames.description: Ensures param names in jsdoc and in function declaration are equal

checkRedundantParams.description: Ensures params in jsdoc contains type

requireSpaceBeforeBlockStatements.description: Requires space before block statements (for loops, control structures).

disallowSpaceBeforeBlockStatements.description: Disallows space before block statements (for loops, control structures).

requireParenthesesAroundIIFE.description: Requires parentheses around immediately invoked function expressions.

requireBlocksOnNewline.description: Requires blocks to begin and end with a newline.

requirePaddingNewlinesInBlocks.description: Requires blocks to begin and end with 2 newlines.

disallowPaddingNewlinesInBlocks.description: Disallows blocks from beginning and ending with 2 newlines.

disallowEmptyBlocks.description: Disallows empty blocks (except for catch blocks).

disallowSpacesInsideObjectBrackets.description: Disallows space after opening object curly brace and before closing.

disallowSpacesInsideArrayBrackets.description: Disallows space after opening array square bracket and before closing.

disallowSpacesInsideParentheses.description: Disallows space after opening round bracket and before closing.

requireSpacesInsideObjectBrackets.description: Requires space after opening object curly brace and before closing.

requireSpacesInsideArrayBrackets.description: Requires space after opening array square bracket and before closing.

disallowQuotedKeysInObjects.description: Disallows quoted keys in object if possible.

disallowDanglingUnderscores.description: Disallows identifiers that start or end in '_', except for some popular exceptions:

disallowCommaBeforeLineBreak.description: Disallows commas as last token on a line in lists.

requireCommaBeforeLineBreak.description: Requires commas as last token on a line in lists.

requireAlignedObjectValues.description: Requires proper alignment in object literals.

requireLeftStickedOperators.description: Requires sticking operators to the left.

requireCamelCaseOrUpperCaseIdentifiers.description: Requires identifiers to be camelCased or UPPERCASE_WITH_UNDERSCORES

disallowMultipleLineStrings.description: Disallows strings that span multiple lines without using concatenation.

disallowMultipleLineBreaks.description: Disallows multiple blank lines in a row.

validateLineBreaks.description: Option to check line break characters.

validateQuoteMarks.description: Requires all quote marks to be either the supplied value, or consistent if true

validateIndentation.description: Validates indentation for arrays, objects, switch statements, and block statements.

disallowMixedSpacesAndTabs.description: Requires lines to not contain both spaces and tabs consecutively, or spaces after tabs only for alignment if "smart"

disallowTrailingWhitespace.description: Requires all lines to end on a non-whitespace character.

disallowTrailingComma.description: Disallows an extra comma following the final element of an array or object literal.

requireTrailingComma.description: Requires an extra comma following the final element of an array or object literal.

requireLineFeedAtFileEnd.description: Requires placing line feed at file end.

maximumLineLength.description: Requires all lines to be at most the number of characters specified.

requireCapitalizedConstructors.description: Requires constructors to be capitalized (except for "this")

safeContextKeyword.description: Option to check "var that = this" expressions.

requireDotNotation.description: Requires member expressions to use dot notation when possible.

disallowYodaConditions.description: Requires the variable to be the left hand operator when doing a boolean comparison.

excludeFiles.description: Disables style checking for specified paths.

preset.description: Extends defined rules with preset rules.

http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#.description: Modified JSON Schema draft v4 that includes the optional '$ref' and 'format'

root.title: Schema for JSON-LD

@context.description: Used to define the short-hand names that are used throughout a JSON-LD document.

@id.description: Used to uniquely identify things that are being described in the document with IRIs or blank node identifiers.

@value.description: Used to specify the data that is associated with a particular property in the graph.

@language.description: Used to specify the language for a particular string value or the default language of a JSON-LD document.

@type.description: Used to set the data type of a node or typed value.

@container.description: Used to set the default container type for a term.

@list.description: Used to express an ordered set of data.

@set.description: Used to express an unordered set of data and to ensure that values are always represented as arrays.

@base.description: Used to set the base IRI against which relative IRIs are resolved

@vocab.description: Used to expand properties and values in @type with a common prefix IRI

root.title: JSON schema for Google Chrome extension manifest files

manifest_version.description: One integer specifying the version of the manifest file format your package requires.

version.description: One to four dot-separated integers identifying the version of this extension.

default_locale.description: Specifies the subdirectory of _locales that contains the default strings for this extension.

description.description: A plain text description of the extension

icons.description: One or more icons that represent the extension, app, or theme. Recommended format: PNG; also BMP, GIF, ICO, JPEG.

16.description: Used as the favicon for an extension's pages and infobar.

48.description: Used on the extension management page (chrome://extensions).

128.description: Used during installation and in the Chrome Web Store.

256.description: Used during installation and in the Chrome Web Store.

browser_action.description: Use browser actions to put icons in the main Google Chrome toolbar, to the right of the address bar. In addition to its icon, a browser action can also have a tooltip, a badge, and a popup.

page_action.description: Use the chrome.pageAction API to put icons inside the address bar. Page actions represent actions that can be taken on the current page, but that aren't applicable to all pages.

background.description: The background page is an HTML page that runs in the extension process. It exists for the lifetime of your extension, and only one instance of it at a time is active.

persistent.description: When false, makes the background page an event page (loaded only when needed).

page.description: Specify the HTML of the background page.

scripts.description: A background page will be generated by the extension system that includes each of the files listed in the scripts property.

chrome_url_overrides.description: Override pages are a way to substitute an HTML file from your extension for a page that Google Chrome normally provides.

bookmarks.description: The page that appears when the user chooses the Bookmark Manager menu item from the Chrome menu or, on Mac, the Bookmark Manager item from the Bookmarks menu. You can also get to this page by entering the URL chrome://bookmarks.

history.description: The page that appears when the user chooses the History menu item from the Chrome menu or, on Mac, the Show Full History item from the History menu. You can also get to this page by entering the URL chrome://history.

newtab.description: The page that appears when the user creates a new tab or window. You can also get to this page by entering the URL chrome://newtab.

commands.description: Use the commands API to add keyboard shortcuts that trigger actions in your extension, for example, an action to open the browser action or send a command to the extension.

content_scripts.description: Content scripts are JavaScript files that run in the context of web pages.

matches.description: Specifies which pages this content script will be injected into.

exclude_matches.description: Excludes pages that this content script would otherwise be injected into.

css.description: The list of CSS files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array, before any DOM is constructed or displayed for the page.

js.description: The list of JavaScript files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array.

run_at.description: Controls when the files in js are injected.

all_frames.description: Controls whether the content script runs in all frames of the matching page, or only the top frame.

include_globs.description: Applied after matches to include only those URLs that also match this glob. Intended to emulate the @include Greasemonkey keyword.

exclude_globs.description: Applied after matches to exclude URLs that match this glob. Intended to emulate the @exclude Greasemonkey keyword.

devtools_page.description: A DevTools extension adds functionality to the Chrome DevTools. It can add new UI panels and sidebars, interact with the inspected page, get information about network requests, and more.

externally_connectable.description: Declares which extensions, apps, and web pages can connect to your extension via runtime.connect and runtime.sendMessage.

file_browser_handlers.description: You can use this API to enable users to upload files to your website.

id.description: Used by event handling code to differentiate between multiple file handlers

homepage_url.description: The URL of the homepage for this extension.

incognito.description: Specify how this extension will behave if allowed to run in incognito mode.

input_components.description: Allows your extension to handle keystrokes, set the composition, and manage the candidate window.

key.description: This value can be used to control the unique ID of an extension, app, or theme when it is loaded during development.

minimum_chrome_version.description: The version of Chrome that your extension, app, or theme requires, if any.

nacl_modules.description: One or more mappings from MIME types to the Native Client module that handles each type.

path.description: The location of a Native Client manifest (a .nmf file) within the extension directory.

mime_type.description: The MIME type for which the Native Client module will be registered as content handler.

oauth2.description: Use the Chrome Identity API to authenticate users: the getAuthToken for users logged into their Google Account and the launchWebAuthFlow for users logged into a non-Google account.

client_id.description: You need to register your app in the Google APIs Console to get the client ID.

offline_enabled.description: Whether the app or extension is expected to work offline. When Chrome detects that it is offline, apps with this field set to true will be highlighted on the New Tab page.

omnibox.description: The omnibox API allows you to register a keyword with Google Chrome's address bar, which is also known as the omnibox.

keyword.description: The keyward that will trigger your extension.

optional_permissions.description: Use the chrome.permissions API to request declared optional permissions at run time rather than install time, so users understand why the permissions are needed and grant only those that are necessary.

options_page.description: To allow users to customize the behavior of your extension, you may wish to provide an options page. If you do, a link to it will be provided from the extensions management page at chrome://extensions. Clicking the Options link opens a new tab pointing at your options page.

permissions.description: Permissions help to limit damage if your extension or app is compromised by malware. Some permissions are also displayed to users before installation, as detailed in Permission Warnings.

requirements.description: Technologies required by the app or extension. Hosting sites such as the Chrome Web Store may use this list to dissuade users from installing apps or extensions that will not work on their computer.

3D.description: The '3D' requirement denotes GPU hardware acceleration.

features.description: List of the 3D-related features your app requires.

plugins.description: Indicates if an app or extension requires NPAPI to run. This requirement is enabled by default when the manifest includes the 'plugins' field.

sandbox.description: Defines an collection of app or extension pages that are to be served in a sandboxed unique origin, and optionally a Content Security Policy to use with them.

script_badge.description: Control the behaviour of the script badge.

default_title.description: Tooltip for the script badge's icon

default_popup.description: The html document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the script badge's icon.

short_name.description: The short name is typically used where there is insufficient space to display the full name.

update_url.description: If you publish using the Chrome Developer Dashboard, ignore this field. If you host your own extension or app: URL to an update manifest XML file.

tts_engine.description: Register itself as a speech engine.

voice_name.description: Identifies the name of the voice and the engine used.

lang.description: Almost always, a voice can synthesize speech in just a single language. When an engine supports more than one language, it can easily register a separate voice for each language.

gender.description: If your voice corresponds to a male or female voice, you can use this parameter to help clients choose the most appropriate voice for their application.

event_types.description: Events sent to update the client on the progress of speech synthesis.

web_accessible_resources.description: An array of strings specifying the paths (relative to the package root) of packaged resources that are expected to be usable in the context of a web page.

default_title.description: Tooltip for the main toolbar icon.

default_popup.description: The popup appears when the user clicks the icon.

content_security_policy.description: This introduces some fairly strict policies that will make extensions more secure by default, and provides you with the ability to create and enforce rules governing the types of content that can be loaded and executed by your extensions and applications.

root.title: JSON schema for NPM package.json files

^_.description: Any property starting with _ is valid.

url.description: The url to your project's issue tracker.

email.description: The email address to which issues should be reported.

license.description: You should specify a license for your package so that people know how they are permitted to use it, and any restrictions you're placing on it.

main.description: The main field is a module ID that is the primary entry point to your program.

man.description: Specify either a single file or an array of filenames to put in place for the man program to find.

bundleDependencies.description: Array of package names that will be bundled when publishing the package.

bundledDependencies.description: Array of package names that will be bundled when publishing the package.

preferGlobal.description: If your package is primarily a command-line application that should be installed globally, then set this value to true to provide a warning if it is installed locally.

private.description: If set to true, then npm will refuse to publish it.

http://schemastore.org/schemas/json/jshi.title: JSON schema for JSHint configuration files

curly.description: Require {} for every new block or scope

forin.description: Require filtering for..in loops with obj.hasOwnProperty()

immed.description: Require immediate invocations to be wrapped in parens e.g. `(function () { } ());`

indent.description: Number of spaces to use for indentation

latedef.description: Require variables/functions to be defined before being used

newcap.description: Require capitalization of all constructor functions e.g. `new F()`

nonew.description: Prohibit use of constructors for side-effects (without assignment)

undef.description: Require all non-global variables to be declared (prevents global leaks)

unused.description: Require all defined variables be used

strict.description: Requires all functions run in ES5 Strict Mode

maxparams.description: Max number of formal params allowed per function

maxdepth.description: Max depth of nested blocks (within functions)

maxlen.description: Max number of characters per line

boss.description: Tolerate assignments where comparisons would be expected

debug.description: Allow debugger statements e.g. browser breakpoints

es5.description: Allow ES5 syntax (ex: getters and setters)

moz.description: Allow Mozilla specific syntax (extends and overrides esnext features)

funcscope.description: Tolerate defining variables inside control statements

lastsemic.description: Tolerate omitting a semicolon for the last statement of a 1-line block

loopfunc.description: Tolerate functions being defined in loops

smarttabs.description: Tolerate mixed tabs/spaces when used for alignment

shadow.description: Allows re-define variables later in code e.g. `var x=1; x=2;`

sub.description: Tolerate using `[]` notation when it can still be expressed in dot notation

validthis.description: Tolerate using this in a non-constructor function

expand.description: Must be set to true to use properties other than 'src' and 'dest'

cwd.description: All 'src' matches are relative to (but don't include) this path

ext.description: Replace any existing extension with this value in generated 'dest' paths.

extDot.description: Used to indicate where the period indicating the extension is located.

filter.description: The 'filter' property can help you target files with a greater level of detail

flatten.description: Remove all path parts from generated 'dest' paths

matchBase.description: If set, patterns without slashes will be matched against the basename of the path if it contains slashes. For example, 'a?b' would match the path '/xyz/123/acb', but not '/xyz/acb/123'.

root.title: A schema for Umbraco's package.manifest files.
root.description: An array of Umbraco Property Editors

editor.description: This describes details about the editor

view.description: This is the full path to the HTML view for your property editor

hideLabel.description: If set to true this hides the label for the property editor when used in Umbraco on a document type

valueType.description: This is the type of data you want your property editor to save to Umbraco

validation.description: Object describing required validators on the editor

isReadOnly.description: If set to true this makes the property editor read only

alias.description: This must be a unique alias to your property editor

defaultConfig.description: Provides a collection of default configuration values, in cases the property editor is not configured or is used a parameter editor, which doesnt allow configuration. The object is a key/value collection and must match the prevalue fields keys.

isParameterEditor.description: Enables the property editor as a macro parameter editor can be true/false

name.description: The friendly name of the property editor, shown in the Umbraco backoffice

prevalues.description: This is an object that stores an array of prevalue fields or options to configure yout property editor

fields.description: This is the collection of prevalue fields

key.description: A unique key for the prevalue field

label.description: The user friendly label for the prevalue

description.description: A more detailed description for the user

view.description: The type of editor to use for this prevalue field

javascript.description: A list of Javascript files with full path to load for your property editor

css.description: A list of CSS files with full path to load for your property editor

propertyEditors.description: Returns an array of editor objects, each object specifies an editor to make available to data types as an editor component. These editors are primarily property editors for content, media and members, but can also be made available as a macro parameter editor.

parameterEditors.description: Returns an array of editor objects, each object specifies an editor to make available to macro parameters as an editor component. These editors work solely as parameter editors, and will not show up on the property editors list.

root.title: JSON schema for ASP.NET project.json files

code.description: RegEx pattern to specify all the code files that needs to be compiled. (data type: semicolon separated RegEx pattern(s)). Example: Folder1\*.cs;Folder2\*.cs.

preprocess.description: RegEx pattern to indicate all the code files to be preprocessed. (data type: semicolon separated RegEx pattern(s)).

resources.description: RegEx pattern to indicate all the files that needs to be compiled as resources. (data type: semicolon separated RegEx pattern(s)).

root.title: Resume Schema

picture.description: URL (as per RFC 3986) to a picture in JPEG or PNG format

phone.description: Phone numbers are stored as strings so use any format you like, e.g. 712-117-2923

summary.description: Write a short 2-3 sentence biography about yourself

countryCode.description: code as per ISO-3166-1 ALPHA-2, e.g. US, AU, IN

region.description: The general region where you live. Can be a US state, or a province, for instance.

website.description: URL (as per RFC 3986) to your website, e.g. personal homepage

profiles.description: Specify any number of social networks that you participate in

startDate.description: resume.json uses the ISO 8601 date standard e.g. 2014-06-29

summary.description: Give an overview of your responsibilities at the company

items.description: e.g. Increased profits by 20% from 2011-2012 through viral advertising
e.g. H1302 - Introduction to American history

awards.description: Specify any awards you have received throughout your professional career

title.description: e.g. One of the 100 greatest minds of the century

publications.description: Specify your publications through your career

keywords.description: List some keywords pertaining to this skill

reference.description: e.g. Joe blogs was a great employee, who turned up to work at least once a week. He exceeded my expectations when it came to doing nothing.

root.title: JSON schema for the Source Maps v3

^x_.description: Any property starting with 'x_' is valid.

version.description: File version (always the first entry in the object) and must be a positive integer.

file.default: An optional name of the generated code that this source map is associated with.

sourceRoot.default: An optional source root, useful for relocating source files on a server or removing repeated values in the 'sources' entry.  This value is prepended to the individual entries in the 'source' field.

sources.description: A list of original sources used by the 'mappings' entry.

sourcesContent.description: An optional list of source content, useful when the 'source' can�t be hosted. The contents are listed in the same order as the sources in line 5. 'null' may be used if some original sources should be retrieved by name.

names.description: A list of symbol names used by the 'mappings' entry.

mappings.description: A string with the encoded mapping data.

root.title: A JSON Schema for Swagger 2.0 API.

version.description: A semantic version number of the API.

title.description: A unique and precise title of the API.

description.description: A longer description of the API. Should be different from the title.

termsOfService.description: The terms of service for the API.

contact.description: Contact information for the owners of the API.

name.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.

url.description: The URL pointing to the contact information.

email.description: The email address of the contact person/organization.

type.description: The name of the type of license. It's encouraged to use an OSI compatible license.

url.description: The URL pointing to the license.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the HTTP message.

summary.description: A brief summary of the operation.

description.description: A longer description of the operation.

nickname.description: A friendly name of the operation. Whitespaces are not allowed

produces.description: A list of MIME types the API can produce.

parameters.description: The parameters needed to send a valid API call.

responses.description: Response objects names can either be any valid HTTP status code or 'default'.

kind.description: Determines the location of the parameter.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.

required.description: Determines whether or not this parameter is required or optional.

model.description: A deterministic version of a JSON Schema object.

swagger.description: The Swagger version of this document.

host.description: The fully qualified URI to the host of the API.

basePath.description: The base path to the API. Example: '/api'.

schemes.description: The transfer protocol of the API.

consumes.description: A list of MIME types accepted by the API.

produces.description: A list of MIME types the API can produce.

paths.description: Relative paths to the individual endpoints. They should be relative to the 'basePath'.

models.description: One or more JSON objects describing the models being consumed and produced by the API.

^_.description: Any property starting with _ is valid.

http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#.description: Modified JSON Schema draft v4 that includes the optional '$ref' and 'format'

http://schemastore.org/schemas/json/jshi.title: JSON schema for JSHint configuration files

curly.description: Require {} for every new block or scope

forin.description: Require filtering for..in loops with obj.hasOwnProperty()

immed.description: Require immediate invocations to be wrapped in parens e.g. `(function () { } ());`

indent.description: Number of spaces to use for indentation

latedef.description: Require variables/functions to be defined before being used

newcap.description: Require capitalization of all constructor functions e.g. `new F()`

nonew.description: Prohibit use of constructors for side-effects (without assignment)

undef.description: Require all non-global variables to be declared (prevents global leaks)

unused.description: Require all defined variables be used

strict.description: Requires all functions run in ES5 Strict Mode

maxparams.description: Max number of formal params allowed per function

maxdepth.description: Max depth of nested blocks (within functions)

maxlen.description: Max number of characters per line

boss.description: Tolerate assignments where comparisons would be expected

debug.description: Allow debugger statements e.g. browser breakpoints

es5.description: Allow ES5 syntax (ex: getters and setters)

moz.description: Allow Mozilla specific syntax (extends and overrides esnext features)

funcscope.description: Tolerate defining variables inside control statements

lastsemic.description: Tolerate omitting a semicolon for the last statement of a 1-line block

loopfunc.description: Tolerate functions being defined in loops

smarttabs.description: Tolerate mixed tabs/spaces when used for alignment

shadow.description: Allows re-define variables later in code e.g. `var x=1; x=2;`

sub.description: Tolerate using `[]` notation when it can still be expressed in dot notation

validthis.description: Tolerate using this in a non-constructor function

expand.description: Must be set to true to use properties other than 'src' and 'dest'

cwd.description: All 'src' matches are relative to (but don't include) this path

ext.description: Replace any existing extension with this value in generated 'dest' paths.

extDot.description: Used to indicate where the period indicating the extension is located.

filter.description: The 'filter' property can help you target files with a greater level of detail

flatten.description: Remove all path parts from generated 'dest' paths

matchBase.description: If set, patterns without slashes will be matched against the basename of the path if it contains slashes. For example, 'a?b' would match the path '/xyz/123/acb', but not '/xyz/acb/123'.

nonull.description: If set to 'true' then the operation will include non-matching patterns. Combined with grunt's '--verbose' flag, this option can help debug file path issues.

rename.description: This function is called for each matched 'src' file, (after extension renaming and flattening).

src.description: Pattern(s) to match, relative to the 'cwd'.

root.title: JSON schema for the TSLint configuration files

ban.description: Bans the use of specific functions

class-name.description: Enforces PascalCased class and interface names

curly.description: Enforces braces for if/for/do/while statements

eofline.description: Enforces the file to end with a newline

forin.description: Enforces a for...in  statement to be filtered with an if statement

indent.description: Enforces consistent indentation levels

interface-name.description: Enforces the rule that interface names must begin with a capital 'I'

jsdoc-format.description: Enforces basic format rules for jsdoc comments

label-position.description: Enforces labels only on sensible statements

label-undefined.description: Checks that labels are defined before usage

max-line-length.description: Sets the maximum length of a line

no-any.description: diallows usages of any as a type decoration

no-console.description: Disallows access to the specified functions on console

no-consecutive-blank-lines.description: Disallows having more than one blank line in a row in a file

no-construct.description: Disallows access to the constructors of String, Number and Boolean

no-duplicate-key.description: Disallows duplicate keys in object literals

no-string-literal.description: Disallows object access via string literals

no-trailing-comma.description: Disallows trailing comma within object literals

no-trailing-whitespace.description: Disallows trailing whitespace at the end of a line

no-unused-variable.description: Disallows unused imports, variables, functions and private class members

no-unreachable.description: Disallows unreachable code after break, catch, throw and return statements

no-use-before-declare.description: Disallows usage of variables before their declaration

no-var-requires.description: Disallows the use of require statements except in import statements

one-line.description: Enforces the specified tokens to be on the same line as the expression preceding it

quotemark.description: Enforces consistent single or double quoted string literals

radix.description: Enforces the radix parameter of parseInt

semicolon.description: Enforces semicolons at the end of every statement

triple-equals.description: Enforces === and !== in favor of == and !=

typedef-whitespace.description: Enforces spacing whitespace for type definitions

variable-name.description: Allows only camelCased or UPPER_CASED variable names

root.title: JSON schema for Azure Webjobs configuration files

webJobName.description: The name of the Azure Webjob.

startTime.description: The start time of a scheduled job. Example. 2014-06-11T00:00:00-08:00

endTime.description: The end time of a scheduled job. Example. 2014-06-12T00:00:00-08:00

jobRecurrenceFrequency.description: The frequency metric used with the 'interval' property.

interval.description: The interval of how often the Azure Webjob should run. Use it with the 'intervalType' property.

runMode.description:
Determines the run mode of the Azure Webjob. 

 Triggered: manually triggered 
 Scheduled: runs on a specific schedule 
 Continuous: runs all the time

Determines the run mode of the Azure Webjob. 

 Triggered: manually triggered 
 Scheduled: runs on a specific schedule 
 Continuous: runs all the time
